```{r setup-chunk, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(dev = "png",
                      dpi = 300,
                      echo = FALSE,
                      cache = TRUE)
```

```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```


```{r}
load("TotalAnalyzedData.Rda")
```

```{r}
#summarize everything
GroupedSentimentData <- TotalAnalyzedData %>% group_by(PlayerName, TotalEpisodeNumber) %>% 
  summarise(WordCount =  sum(WordCount,na.rm=TRUE), 
            JockersSentiment = sum(JockSent), 
            Trust = sum(trust), 
            Fear = sum(fear), 
            Sadness = sum(sadness), 
            Anger = sum(anger), 
            Surprise = sum(surprise), 
            Disgust = sum(disgust), 
            Joy = sum(joy), 
            Anticipation = sum(anticipation), 
            Profanity = sum(profanity)) %>% 
  arrange(TotalEpisodeNumber)
# Wordcount is NA if someone just said a number. Having sum of wordcount ignore that to get a more accurate wordcount.

#TotalAnalyzedData[TotalAnalyzedData$PlayerName == "ERIKA",]

#filter out some abnormal names and agrigation names and production crew from the early episodes, audience, etc. -anyone who did not play a character
GroupedSentimentData.Filter <- GroupedSentimentData %>% 
  filter(!PlayerName %in% c("ZAC",
                            "CREW",
                            "LUCAS",
                            "SEVERAL",
                            "COMPUTER-GENERATED VOICE",
                            "OTHERS",
                            "RYAN",
                            "ERIKA",
                            "STEVE",
                            "ALL BUT ORION",
                            "ALEC",
                            "GROUP",
                            "EVERYONE",
                            "AUDIENCE MEMBER",
                            "AUDIENCE",
                            "IPHONE",
                            "OFFSCREEN",
                            "BRIAN", #never played a character but did their talk show. Not important to this analysis
                            "OFF-SCREEN",
                            "DENISE",
                            "EVERYBODY",
                            "ALL BUT SAM",
                            "BABS",
                            "CAST",
                            "LENORE",
                            "TRAVIS' PHONE",
                            "ALL TOGETHER",
                            "ALL"
                            ))
```


Look into averages for tabular results
```{r}
#Calculate Averages - every speaker
AveragePlayerSentiments.Total <- GroupedSentimentData.Filter %>% 
  mutate(JockersSentimentPerWord = JockersSentiment/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(TrustPerWord = Trust/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(FearPerWord = Fear/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(SadnessPerWord = Sadness/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(AngerPerWord = Anger/WordCount) %>%
```

Plot Averages - Jocker
```{r Plot Averages - Jocker}
AveragePlayerSentiments.Total %>% 
  top_n(n=10, AvgJockPerWord) %>% 
  ggplot(., aes(x = reorder(PlayerName, -AvgJockPerWord), y = AvgJockPerWord))+
  geom_col()+
  xlab('Player Name') +
  ylab('Average Jocker Sentiment per Word') +
  ggtitle('Total Show Average Jocker Sentiment per Word')+
  theme_minimal()


AveragePlayerSentiments.C1 %>% 
  top_n(n=10, AvgJockPerWord) %>% 
  ggplot(., aes(x = reorder(PlayerName, -AvgJockPerWord), y = AvgJockPerWord))+
  geom_col()+
  xlab('Player Name') +
  ylab('Average Jocker Sentiment per Word') +
  ggtitle('Campaign 1 Average Jocker Sentiment per Word')+
  theme_minimal()

AveragePlayerSentiments.C2 %>% 
  top_n(n=10, AvgJockPerWord) %>% 
  ggplot(., aes(x = reorder(PlayerName, -AvgJockPerWord), y = AvgJockPerWord))+
  geom_col()+
  xlab('Player Name') +
  ylab('Average Jocker Sentiment per Word') +
  ggtitle('Campaign 2 Average Jocker Sentiment per Word')+
  theme_minimal()

AveragePlayerSentiments.C3 %>% 
  top_n(n=10, AvgJockPerWord) %>% 
  ggplot(., aes(x = reorder(PlayerName, -AvgJockPerWord), y = AvgJockPerWord))+
  geom_col()+
  xlab('Player Name') +
  ylab('Average Jocker Sentiment per Word') +
  ggtitle('Campaign 3 Average Jocker Sentiment per Word')+
  theme_minimal()

```

Guest Stars tend to be the most positive. Chris Perkins is particularly positive in campaign 1. He is one of the head designers for D&D at Wizards of the Coast and is likely trying to show a positive light. His campaign 1 character is Shale, a wise old goliath who help Vox Machina fight a dragon. Also briefly played Splart, a comic relief kobold in campaign 2. His lines are very brief there, hence why he doesn't pop up in the top of Campaign 2.
Ashley's campaign 3 character is a super positive Fawn called Fearne. Her manerisms seem very positive.

Grog is a potty mouth. Simple mind, simple words.
Ashly played a very vulgar character that went through trauma on the show.
Taliesin plays the tough guy in C3.
Travis wins the soap in mouth award for the regulars. 



Make some filters and groupings
```{r}
#Filter to Main Cast

MainCastSentiments <- GroupedSentimentData %>% filter(PlayerName %in% c("MATT", "ASHLEY", "TRAVIS", "MARISHA", "LAURA", "LIAM", "SAM", "TALIESIN"))

# Weighting by wordcount, Matt talks so much more, lets put it into perspective
MainCastSentiments <- MainCastSentiments %>% 
  mutate(JockersSentimentPerWord = JockersSentiment/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(TrustPerWord = Trust/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(FearPerWord = Fear/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(SadnessPerWord = Sadness/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(AngerPerWord = Anger/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(SurprisePerWord = Surprise/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(DisgustPerWord = Disgust/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(JoyPerWord = Joy/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(AnticipationPerWord = Anticipation/WordCount) %>% 
  mutate(ProfanityPerWord = Profanity/WordCount)

#Main Cast Without Matt
MainCastSentiments.NoDM <- MainCastSentiments %>% filter(PlayerName != "MATT")

#Individual Players
MattSentiments <- MainCastSentiments %>% filter(PlayerName == "MATT")
AshleySentiments <- MainCastSentiments %>% filter(PlayerName == "ASHLEY")
TravisSentiments <- MainCastSentiments %>% filter(PlayerName == "TRAVIS")
MarishaSentiments <- MainCastSentiments %>% filter(PlayerName == "MARISHA")
LauraSentiments <- MainCastSentiments %>% filter(PlayerName == "LAURA")
LiamSentiments <- MainCastSentiments %>% filter(PlayerName == "LIAM")
SamSentiments <- MainCastSentiments %>% filter(PlayerName == "SAM")
TaliesinSentiments <- MainCastSentiments %>% filter(PlayerName == "TALIESIN")


##Cast by campaign with no Matt
#C1
MainCastSentiments.C1 <- MainCastSentiments %>% 
filter(TotalEpisodeNumber < 116)

MainCastSentiments.C2 <- MainCastSentiments %>% 
filter(TotalEpisodeNumber >= 116 & TotalEpisodeNumber < 257)

MainCastSentiments.C3 <- MainCastSentiments %>% 
filter(TotalEpisodeNumber >= 257)

##Cast by campaign
#C1
MainCastSentiments.C1.NoDM <- MainCastSentiments.C1 %>% filter(PlayerName != "MATT")
#C2
MainCastSentiments.C2.NoDM <- MainCastSentiments.C2 %>% filter(PlayerName != "MATT")
#C3
MainCastSentiments.C3.NoDM <- MainCastSentiments.C3 %>% filter(PlayerName != "MATT")




#Total Grouping by episode
GroupedSentimentData.byEpisode <- TotalAnalyzedData %>% group_by(TotalEpisodeNumber) %>% 
  summarise(WordCount =  sum(WordCount,na.rm=TRUE), 
            JockersSentiment = sum(JockSent), 
            Trust = sum(trust), 
            Fear = sum(fear), 
            Sadness = sum(sadness), 
            Anger = sum(anger), 
            Surprise = sum(surprise), 
            Disgust = sum(disgust), 
            Joy = sum(joy), 
            Anticipation = sum(anticipation), 
            Profanity = sum(profanity)) %>% 
  arrange(TotalEpisodeNumber)



```
